description:
A brutal scourge stalks the land. Yoma, monsters driven by a hunger satisfied by only one quarry - Humanity. The dark breed knows but a singular foe: Claymore. Human-Yoma hybrids of extraordinary strength and cunning, the Claymores roam from skirmish to skirmish delivering salvation by the edge of a blade.

Thus begins the twisting tale of Clare, one such sister of the sword driven by pain in both victory and defeat. A child silent and suffering hidden in her past, Clare's march toward vengeance unfolds along a path marked by violence, solitude and scorn. In a land where even the predator is prey, the haunted hearts of hunter and hunted alike wear the scars of the age.

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Revenge

tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

node.description:
[Website](http://themonicarial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rialisms) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rialisms/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaY5WvG6QScTq6dlRbCbp7Q)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer affiliated with Funimation and Seraphim Digital/Sentai Filmworks.

Monica's father is from Pontevedra, Galicia, Spain, and when she was young, her family would often visit there. She would translate for her younger brother some of the European Spanish-dubbed cartoons which included anime like Doraemon and Dragon Ball Z, often imitating the various characters. Monica studied ballet, tap, and jazz, but transitioned to musical theater when was 12. She studied acting through high school as well as college at the University of Houston. She's cited voice actor inspirations from The Simpsons, Family Guy, and Beavis and Butt-head. She was working on a theater show with Jason Douglas, who suggested she audition for ADV Films. Her first voice-over role was a walla in the 1999 dub of Martian Successor Nadesico.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
Born in Kaufman, Texas

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ccarrollbeard) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/colleen.clinkenbeardvoiceactress)

An American voice actress and theatre actress, working mainly in the commercial and dubbing industries. She has also served as ADR director, line producer, and script writer for several anime titles for Funimation.

She gave birth to her first son, Rhodes Vandelo Carroll, on September 4, 2014.

A voice actress and producer specializing in televised anime. Harp was hired by FUNimation Entertainment in 2003 to voice the character of Tweedledee in Kiddy Grade. Since then, her work has included Sei in Burst Angel, Sanae in Akira Kurosawa's Samurai 7, Hibari Ginza in Speed Grapher and additional roles in Yu Yu Hakusho, Spiral, Fullmetal Alchemist, Case Closed, Desert Punk, Baki the Grappler, The Galaxy Railways, Negima, and BECK.    Her portrayal as Hibari Ginza in the 2006-2007 release of Speed Grapher won her an award in the ADR Awards as voted by members of the websites Dub Review and Anime on DVD.    Harp is also the inspiration for Aubrey Chorde, one of the main characters in the webcomic Something Positive by her friend R.K. Milholland. He claims he decided to make the comic after she told him to do "something positive" with his life. She currently lives and works in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area of Texas. Her hobbies include knitting, crafts and collecting Hello Kitty Memorabilia. (Wikipedia)

He won the 32nd Akatsuka Award for his debut work, Undeadman. 

In his spare time, Yagi enjoys things like the Japanese comedic duo Downtown, martial arts, games, driving, and hard rock and metal music, but he doesn't consider these actual hobbies.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__Height:__ 151 cm

She auditioned to join a J-pop group being created by Konami and Toshiba-EMI and was successful at just 15 years of age. This group later became BeForU which went on to make many songs for various video games. She has since started a solo career having released 6 singles to date. She also collaborated with Ryo Horikawa as a radio personality for Pakedio Channel in 2005 and 2006.

[Official Website](https://www.nightmare-web.com/pc/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/11CxpTfZC60MYKjL7HESKR?autoplay=true) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nightmare_staff)

Nightmare began in January 2000 by Sakito and Hitsugi while most of the members were still in high school. Soon, Yomi was invited by Sakito, Ni-ya by Hitsugi, and Zannin joined after they heard their classmates were forming a band. They were all influenced by either X Japan or Luna Sea in some form.  Most of their songs have a heavy metal element with a heavy bass line, tricky rhythms and changes in melodic keys. Although their recent songs have a slight avantgarde/alternative element (this is prominent especially in their "anima" album), the band has still kept its roots from their indies' days. They have also experimented with jazz, ambience, electronica, techno and bossa nova styles of music. Even though most of their songs are fast tempoed, they have written a fair amount of rock ballads as well.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤雄三)
A producer working for VAP.
[Website](http://www.masa.world/)
She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/136171134)

A long-serving anime producer, as well as a founder of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/), [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) and [Studio M2](https://anilist.co/studio/6137/). He currently serves as the Chairman of the Board at [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Maruyama graduated from Hosei University in 1963, and soon after, he found work at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) in 1965. It was here that he met many of Madhouse's future staff members. In October 1972, he left Mushi Production together with [Rintarou](https://anilist.co/staff/102305/), [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Yoshiaki Kawajiri](https://anilist.co/staff/100812/) and founded Madhouse. From that time onward, Maruyama focused mainly on producing and planning Madhouse's upcoming projects. He also served as the studio's president through the '80s and '90s.

Thanks in large part to his frequent attendance at anime conventions, he has become well-known in America among Madhouse's fanbase. Not simply wanting to emulate past successes, Maruyama frequently says at these events that his goal as a producer is to seek out new challenges that will allow the production staff to keep experimenting. This attitude in part has been the reason why he has encouraged the studio to take on projects that may not seem like sure-fire commercial hits. In addition, Maruyama has long been a supporter of bringing new talents into the animation business, and continues to encourage young people to work in anime.

In 2011, he left Madhouse and founded Mappa. Later in 2016, he left Mappa and founded Studio M2.

(Source: Wikipedia)
The brother of voice actress, [Brina Palencia](https://anilist.co/staff/95659/Brina-Palencia).

Anime Director. He began his career at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he would eventually make his directorial debut with [Claymore](https://anilist.co/anime/1818/). He then notably worked as Assistant Director throughout the [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/) adaptation at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/), and has since continued to serve as Assistant and Episode Director on various projects there.

Affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [Producer](https://anilist.co/staff/155543) or other [Director](https://anilist.co/staff/226420) with the same name._
[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/takahiro.umehara.9) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoPTMWc1Pj14ocQ6EUJALBA)
Affiliated with KUSANAGI.
Affiliated with [Nippon TV](https://anilist.co/studio/6939/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/本田保則) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasunori_Honda)

Founder and representative director of Arts Pro.
